faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Answers to common questions during usage

q1.question: What is Base64 encoding?
q1.answer: Base64 is an encoding method that converts binary data to ASCII characters, commonly used for transmitting binary data in text protocols.

q2.question: Why encode XML with Base64?
q2.answer: Base64 encoding can avoid special characters in XML from being escaped during transmission, and can simply obfuscate sensitive data.

q3.question: What's the maximum XML file size supported?
q3.answer: There's no theoretical size limit, but for optimal user experience, we recommend keeping individual XML files under 10MB.

q4.question: How to validate XML format?
q4.answer: The tool automatically validates XML syntax and displays detailed error messages if the format is incorrect.

q5.question: How is data security ensured?
q5.answer: All conversion operations are performed locally in the browser, no data is uploaded to servers, completely protecting your privacy.
